results.title: The King of Marvin Gardens
results.brief_description: Radio personality David Staebler (Jack Nicholson), uses his brother’s life story as fodder for his radio ramblings, thus anticipating the “talk jocks” of the 1980’s and 90’s. David’s brother Jason (Bruce Dern), is full of lofty ambitions but lacks the wherewithal to accomplish them. He has managed to survive for so long thanks to the help of his older brother. His latest vision for success involves building a resort on a small Hawaiian island and he intends to raise the capital by holding a beauty contest and wining and dining rich Japanese businessmen. Along with Jason’s long suffering wife (Ellen Burstyn), David reluctantly agrees to support his brother one more time.

results.title: The Loves of Carmen
results.brief_description: Produced by Rita Hayworth’s production company, Beckworth, ‘The Loves of Carmen’ is a dramatised version of Carmen which is based, not on Bizet’s opera, but on the story by Prosper Merimee. This is definitely a star vehicle for Hayworth - she sizzles in the role as the beautiful and fiesty Spanish gypsy. She is joined by Glenn Ford who plays the besotted Don Jose. The film is directed by Hayworth’s favourite director, Charles Vidor, and includes some colourful dance and musical scenes, although it is essentially dramatic and not a musical. Rita Hayworth’s father assisted with some of the choreography and her uncle and brother also appear in the film.

results.title: Mrs Brown = Her Majesty Mrs Brown
results.creator_credit: John Madden, Sarah Curtis, BBC, Ecosse Films, Mobil Masterpiece Theatre and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description: Set at the height of Victorian England, ‘Mrs Brown’ tells of the extraordinary relationship between a Queen and a commoner. Judi Dench gives a stunning performance (which was reflected by her Best Actress nomination), as Queen Victoria who begins a doomed, and ultimately tragic relationship with her servant, John Brown (Billy Connolly). Brown brings comfort and life to the Queen’s long period of mourning following the death of her husband, Albert. Where others failed to cheer her up, Brown succeeds, and in doing so secures the Queen’s respect and friendship. The Victorian court is suspicious of their leader’s new found happiness which forces the Queen and Brown to make some painful choices about their relationship, their own needs, and the monarchy. Cast includes Antony Sher, Geoffrey Palmer, Richard Pasco and David Westhead.

results.title: The Ice storm
results.creator_credit: Ang Lee, James Schamus, Ted Hope and Good Machine
results.brief_description: Thanksgiving, 1973, Connecticut, and the future of the United States is in limbo. Though outwardly possessing everything a suburban family could want, inwardly, the Hoods are on thin ice. The transparent windows of the family depict a dysfunctional life of paranoid gossip and swinging key parties. Patriarch Ben Hood, barely communicates with his wife Elena. Frustrated and lonely, Elena is on the verge of an emotional breakdown, while Ben copes by having an affair with their neighbour Janey Carver. As night falls and the members of the family embark on their own sexual odyssey, clouds gather on the horizon for an ice storm that will paralyze the suburbs and transform everyone’s lives for ever. Cast includes Kevin Kline, Joan Allen, Sigourney Weaver, James Sheridan, and Christina Ricci.

results.title: Seven years in Tibet
results.creator_credit: Jean-Jacques Annaud, Iain Smith, John H. Williams, Applecross Productions and Reperage and Vanguard Films
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Austrian climber Heinrich Harrer, this is the amazing true story of his friendship with the Dalai Lama. Climbing in the Himalayas, Harrer is captured as a POW in China at the start of the second world war. He manages to escape the camp and flees across the mountains into isolated Tibet. As one of the few foreigners to ever enter Tibet, Harrer forms a friendship with the young Dalai Lama and becomes his confidante. The film depicts the most tumultuous period of Tibetan history in which China invades and occupies Tibet - an oppression which continues to this day.

results.title: North West Frontier = Flame over India
results.creator_credit: J Thompson, Mariel Hellman and Rank Organisation Film Productions
results.brief_description: Captain Scott (Kenneth More), is commissioned by the British Governor of colonial India for a rescue mission to ensure the safe passage of a five year old Hindi prince and his American governess (Lauren Bacall) out of danger. To achieve this Scott must make a 300 mile journey to Kalapur. The mission is fraught with danger as they are travelling on an old and fragile train, and an assassin has made his way onto the train and is posing as an ally. Cast includes Herbert Lom, Wilfred Hyde-White and Ursula Jeans.

results.title: Campbell's Kingdom
results.creator_credit: Ralph Thomas, Betty E. Box and Rank Organisation Film Productions
results.brief_description: After being told that he only has six months to live, Englishman Bruce Campbell (Dirk Bogarde) dedicates his last days to vindicating his late grandfather’s name. His grandfather long held the belief that his land in the Canadian Rocky Mountains, or as he referred to it, ‘kingdom’, contained precious oil reserves; he was alone in his convictions. Bruce, who is now left with the land is determined to strike oil and comes up against fierce resistance from the leader of a construction gang, Owen Morgan (Stanley Baker). With nothing to lose and a suspicion that they are trying to prevent him from discovering the truth, Bruce has a fatalistic determination to get to the bottom of things. Based on the novel by Hammond Innes. Cast includes Dirk Bogarde, Stanley Baker, Michael Craig and James Robertson Justice.

results.title: Pepi, Luci, Bom & the other girls
results.creator_credit: Pedro Almodovar, Ester Rambal, Pastora Delgado, Pepon Coromina, Figaro Films and Pepon Corominas
results.brief_description: An earlier Almodovar effort which brings to mind some of the more outrageous moments from the films of American director John Waters. Pepi, Luci and Bom’s out-to-offend plot has Pepi (Almodovar regular Carmen Maura), exact revenge on the policeman (Felix Rotaeta) who raped her by having him beaten up by her punk rock pals. When that plan backfires she hatches an even more outlandish plot which involves introducing the policeman’s mousy wife Luci (Eva Siva), to the world of sadomasochism and ‘water sports’, via her friend Bom (Olvido Gara). Of course Pepi never counted on Luci liking it so much! Unfortunately this video version is a slightly modified one from the cinema release (one of the film’s funniest moments where Bom casually urinates in Luci’s face is cut down), but Almodovar’s provocative and endearingly tasteless humour (an ad for women’s underwear that converts to a vibrator comes to mind!), still shines through.

results.title: Ikiru = to live = living = doomed
results.creator_credit: Akira Kurosawa, Shojiro Motoki and Tokyo Film
results.brief_description: ‘Ikiru’ is a departure from Kurosawa’s other work and presents a thoughtful and moving piece on life and death. The film opens with an x-ray detailing the stomach cancer of the main character, Kanji Watanabe. The image sets the premise of the piece but not necessarily the tone, which vacillates between hope and despair. Kanji’s physical and mental health is not only damaged by the cancer within, but as Kurosawa subtly suggests, is also contributed to by the inertia of Kanji’s civil service job and life in post-war Tokyo. The film is primarily concerned with Kanji’s struggle to accept his condition and the downwards spiral that drives him to self destructive behaviour. He eventually meets a girl who convinces him that he should spend his dying months doing good. This prompts him to seek approval for having a children’s playground built. The playground will provide a source of enjoyment to the children of the community as well as be an epitaph to good citizen Kanji. Cast includes Takashi Shimura, Nobuo Kaneko, Kyoko Seki and Miki Odagiri. In Japanese with English subtitles.

results.title: Fallen angels
results.creator_credit: Wong, Jeff Lau and Jet Tone Production
results.brief_description: Fallen Angels is another breathtaking film from Hong Kong director Wong Kar Wai. The film stylishly weaves the stories of a group of characters who traverse Hong Kong city by night. Wong Chi-Ming (Leon Lai) is a hired killer. His partner is an un-named woman (Michelle Reis) whom he has never seen. A young man who doesn’t speak (Takeshi Kaneshiro) videos his father in their tiny Hong Kong flat. Hong Kong, the city, is itself a ‘character’ in the strange meanderings of the stories. Wong Kar Wai (together with Australian cinematographer Chris Doyle) creates a visually stunning, edgy style which none the less is as much about the characters drawn together as cinematic effects. In Cantonese with English subtitles.
